questions.subject: Computer Science
questions.question: What does CPU stand for?
questions.explanation: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit. It is the primary component of a computer that performs most of the processing.

questions.subject: Computer Science
questions.question: Which shortcut key is used to save a document in MS Word?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + S is the shortcut to save a document in MS Word and most other applications. Ctrl + P is Print, Ctrl + O is Open, and Ctrl + N is New.

questions.subject: Computer Science
questions.question: What does WWW stand for?
questions.explanation: WWW stands for World Wide Web, the system of interlinked hypertext documents accessed via the Internet.

questions.subject: Computer Science
questions.question: Which of the following is a programming language?
questions.explanation: Python is a programming language. HTML and CSS are markup/styling languages, and HTTP is a protocol.

questions.subject: Computer Science
questions.question: What is the brain of the computer?
questions.explanation: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is often called the brain of the computer because it performs all the processing and calculations.
